result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Scholl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian J Scholl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian J Scholl was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is to pay $25 per month with the first payment due 10-1-16 and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of every month thereafter until paid in full
.

records.addlTxt:
Signed by SLH -  9 days CJ
VISIONS 12-6-16
Application to Dismiss Cts 1 & 2 filed by ADA Kellis - ORDER TO DISMISS signed by SLH

8:45 AM - (w/ 15TR4431) Def in court w/Atty Thomas Locante.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1 & 2 - dismissed on the merits
Ct. 3 - possession of a controlled substance -  Guilty
15TR4431 - dismissed
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs  
Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
KELLIS: fine is approp. LOCANTE: He has 2 days credit. He's been trying to change his life. He's working hard and tryig to stay out of trouble. DEF: been on bond since last Oct and been out of prison for 2 yrs and it felt good to be used as a role model, so to speak.  It feels good to know I am doing the right things. CRT: you made decisions while in prison to do things different. 
SENTENCE: 4 days CJ w/ credit for 4 days - TIME SERVED
pay CC of $443.00
ext: def to pay $25/mo eff 10/1 or CJ
DNA referral given

ADDRESS INFO for Brian J Scholl
Current: N3688 County Rd M, West Salem, WI 54669 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2016)
Prior: 2609 Jerald St, La Crosse, WI 54603
Jury trial on August 24, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on May 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

8:30 AM - (w/ 15TR4431) - Def in court w/Atty Eric Steven Sanford.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
KELLIS:  it was believed the intox was synthetic THC, but where i  sent it they can't test it. They send them to PA for add'l testing. I have talked to the DA and it's my intention to have the state lab send it to the lab in PA. I wouldn't be prepared to go to trial w/ the current date. It's a quick turn around. The biggest thing is getting the documentation from the State lab to make sure we are paying for it. Once PA gets the sample it's 10-15 days turn around. SANFORD: it's a reasonable solution. He's been on bond since the 21st and has a testing requirement that is combersone as he's working 2 jobs. If the court grants the con't that he not be required to test. KELLIS: I would stip to that. CRT: REMOVE FROM THE CURRENT TRIAL CALENDAR.  DEF IS NO LONGER REQUIRED TO TEST AT JSS
IR:  4/15
